name: df-ordt
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(cordt, cmpt(s0, universe, cfv(ctg, cfv(cfi, cun(csn(cdm(cv(s0))), crn(cun(cmpt(s1, cdm(cv(s0)), crab(s2, cdm(cv(s0)), wn(wbr(cv(s2), cv(s0), cv(s1))))), cmpt(s1, cdm(cv(s0)), crab(s2, cdm(cv(s0)), wn(wbr(cv(s1), cv(s0), cv(s2))))))))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ ordTop =(s0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(topGen `(fi `({ dom(s0)} ⋃ ran(((s1 ∈ dom(s0)↦ { s2 ∈ dom(s0)| ¬ s2[s0]s1 })⋃(s1 ∈ dom(s0)↦ { s2 ∈ dom(s0)| ¬ s1[s0]s2 })))))))
comment: Define the order topology, given an order ` <_ ` , written as ` r ` below. A closed subbasis for the order topology is given by the closed rays ` [ y , +oo ) = { z e. X | y <_ z } ` and ` ( -oo , y ] = { z e. X | z <_ y } ` , along with ` ( -oo , +oo ) = X ` itself. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Sep-2015.)
